title: Encounters: PAT_ENC (7 splits) → Encounter → HealthRecord.visits

PAT_ENC._TABLE_:
The patient encounter table contains one record for each patient encounter in your system. By default, this table does not contain Registration or PCP/Clinic Change contacts (encounter types 1 and 31). It does contain all appointments, office visits, telephone encounters, and other types of encounters. The primary key for the patient encounter table is PAT_ENC_CSN_ID.


Note that there is an index named EIX_FILT_PAT_ENC_RFL on the REFERRAL_ID column in Oracle that does not appear in the index list. The index is created by EFN_FAUX_RFL_FILT_INX.
PAT_ENC.PAT_ID: The unique ID assigned to the patient record. This ID may be encrypted if you have elected to use enterprise reporting�s encryption utility.
PAT_ENC.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
PAT_ENC.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: A unique serial number for this encounter. This number is unique across all patients and encounters in the system.
PAT_ENC.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
PAT_ENC.PCP_PROV_ID: The unique ID of the provider record for the patient�s General Primary Care Provider as of the date of the encounter. This ID may be encrypted if you have elected to use enterprise reporting�s security utility.
PAT_ENC.FIN_CLASS_C_NAME: The category value associated with the Financial Class of the encounter. Note: This item is only populated through an interface. It is not populated if you have billing system installed.
PAT_ENC.VISIT_PROV_ID: The unique ID for the visit provider associated with this encounter. In cases where there are multiple providers for one encounter, this is the ID of the first provider in the list. This item may be NULL if there is no provider for this encounter. This ID may be encrypted.
PAT_ENC.VISIT_PROV_TITLE_NAME: The visit provider�s provider title (SER 5). See VISIT_PROV_ID above for the definition of visit provider.
PAT_ENC.DEPARTMENT_ID: The ID of the department for the encounter. If there are multiple departments for the encounter, this is the ID of the first department in the list.
PAT_ENC.LMP_DATE: The date of the patient�s Last Menstrual Period. Only contains data for encounters with female patients.
PAT_ENC.ENC_CLOSED_YN: A flag that signifies if this encounter is closed as of the time of the enterprise reporting extract. This column will have the value Y, N or null. Null indicates that closing the encounter does not apply, such as a future appointment.
PAT_ENC.ENC_CLOSED_USER_ID: The unique ID of the system user who closed the patient encounter. This ID may be encrypted.
PAT_ENC.ENC_CLOSED_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC.ENC_CLOSE_DATE: The date on which the patient encounter was closed.
PAT_ENC.LOS_MODIFIER1_ID: The first Level of Service modifier applied to the encounter. This item will appear empty if no modifier is present.
PAT_ENC.LOS_MODIFIER1_ID_MODIFIER_NAME: The name of the modifier record.
PAT_ENC.LOS_MODIFIER2_ID: The second Level of Service modifier applied to the encounter. This item will appear empty if no modifier is present.
PAT_ENC.LOS_MODIFIER2_ID_MODIFIER_NAME: The name of the modifier record.
PAT_ENC.LOS_MODIFIER3_ID: The third Level of Service modifier applied to the encounter. This item will appear empty if no modifier is present.
PAT_ENC.LOS_MODIFIER3_ID_MODIFIER_NAME: The name of the modifier record.
PAT_ENC.LOS_MODIFIER4_ID: The fourth Level of Service modifier applied to the encounter. This item will appear empty if no modifier is present.
PAT_ENC.LOS_MODIFIER4_ID_MODIFIER_NAME: The name of the modifier record.
PAT_ENC.APPT_STATUS_C_NAME: The category value associated with the appointment status of the encounter as of the most recent enterprise reporting extract, such as 1 � Scheduled, 2 � Completed, 3 � Canceled, etc.
PAT_ENC.APPT_CANC_USER_ID: The unique ID of the user who canceled the appointment.
PAT_ENC.APPT_CANC_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC.CHECKIN_USER_ID: The unique ID of the system user who checked in the patient for this encounter. If the encounter has not been through the Check In process this field will be NULL. This ID may be encrypted.
PAT_ENC.CHECKIN_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC.HOSP_ADMSN_TIME: The date and time that the patient was first admitted to the facility, bedded in the ED, or confirmed for an HOV for this contact, regardless of patient's base patient class.
PAT_ENC.HOSP_DISCHRG_TIME: The hospital discharge date and time for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC.HOSP_ADMSN_TYPE_C_NAME: The category value for the type of admission for this encounter.
PAT_ENC.NONCVRED_SERVICE_YN: A flag used to indicate whether the appointment is scheduled in a service not covered by the patient's coverage benefits. The flag is set to "Y" when the service is not covered and an "N" when it is covered.
PAT_ENC.REFERRAL_REQ_YN: A flag used to indicate whether an appointment requires a referral as determined by the visit coverage. This flag is set to �Y� when the appointment requires a referral. If the appointment does not require a referral, it is set to �N."
PAT_ENC.REFERRAL_ID: The unique ID of the referral record linked to this appointment.
PAT_ENC.ACCOUNT_ID: The ID number of the guarantor account assigned to the visit at the time it is scheduled or when it is checked in. This ID may be encrypted.
PAT_ENC.COVERAGE_ID: The ID number of the coverage record assigned to the visit at the time it is scheduled or when it is checked in. This ID may be encrypted.
PAT_ENC.CLAIM_ID: The unique ID of the billing system Claim record (CLM record) linked to charges associated with this visit.
PAT_ENC.PRIMARY_LOC_ID: The unique ID of the patient�s primary location as of the contact date of the encounter. Note: This may not be the same as the patient�s current primary location.
PAT_ENC.CHARGE_SLIP_NUMBER: The encounter form number or charge slip number assigned to this encounter. Note: The charge slip number is also stored in the financial table CLARITY_TDL. You can use this field to link to CLARITY_TDL to identify financial transactions associated with the encounter.
PAT_ENC.COPAY_DUE: The dollar amount shown in the Copay Due field of the scheduling system's Check In Patient activity. This amount may be calculated by the system using the patient's coverage benefit information or be manually entered by a user. This field may also be empty if no copay amount was entered when the patient's appointment was checked in.
PAT_ENC.UPDATE_DATE: The time this patient encounter was pulled into enterprise reporting.
PAT_ENC.HSP_ACCOUNT_ID: The ID number of the hospital billing account assigned to the encounter.
PAT_ENC.ADM_FOR_SURG_YN: Indicates whether the patient is being admitted for surgery.
PAT_ENC.SURGICAL_SVC_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the surgical service for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC.INPATIENT_DATA_ID: The ID number of the record used to determine how inpatient data is stored for the encounter.
PAT_ENC.IP_EPISODE_ID: The ID number of the inpatient episode of care. This includes discharges from the ED.
PAT_ENC.EXTERNAL_VISIT_ID: The ID for the contact as assigned by a non-system. Usually populated by an interface.
PAT_ENC.CONTACT_COMMENT: Comments entered by the provider for the contact.
PAT_ENC.OUTGOING_CALL_YN: Indicates whether a call associated with a telephone encounter was initiated by the patient or by the clinic / hospital. A "Y" indicates an outgoing call placed by the clinic / hospital while an "N" indicates and incoming call from the patient.
PAT_ENC.DATA_ENTRY_PERSON: This is the name of the user who created the encounter.
PAT_ENC.REFERRAL_SOURCE_ID: The referral ID number of the referring physician. This physician may be from an external organization.
PAT_ENC.REFERRAL_SOURCE_ID_REFERRING_PROV_NAM: The name of the referral source.
PAT_ENC.WC_TPL_VISIT_C_NAME: A field used to indicate whether the patient's contact is related to workers compensation or third party liability situation.
PAT_ENC.CONSENT_TYPE_C_NAME: This item describes the type of consent that was filed for a given encounter. It is a single-response customer-defined category.
PAT_ENC.BMI: This is the patient's Body Mass Index, which is calculated based on the recorded height and weight.
PAT_ENC.BSA: This is the patient's Body Surface Area, which is calculated based on the recorded height and weight.
PAT_ENC.AVS_PRINT_TM: The instant that the After Visit Summary (AVS) was printed for this encounter.
PAT_ENC.AVS_FIRST_USER_ID: Unique ID of the user who first prints out the After Visit Summary (AVS) for the encounter.
PAT_ENC.AVS_FIRST_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC.ENC_MED_FRZ_RSN_C_NAME: The encounter medication freeze reason's category value.
PAT_ENC.EFFECTIVE_DATE_DT: The date of the encounter. The returned date is handled differently depending on the contact type of the encounter: If it is a surgery encounter, the date of the surgery will be returned. If it is a Hospital encounter, Admission/Discharge/Transfer (ADT) info will be used to return an appropriate date. If ADT info cannot be found, then the  Hospital Admission date (I EPT 18850) will be returned. If the Hospital Admission Date cannot be found, the temporary admission date (I EPT 18846) will be returned..
PAT_ENC.DISCHARGE_DATE_DT: The discharge date for the encounter.
PAT_ENC.COPAY_PD_THRU_NAME: The method by which the copay for an appointment was paid (e.g., via MyChart, a kiosk).
PAT_ENC.INTERPRETER_NEED_YN: A flag used to indicate whether a patient requires an interpreter for an encounter.
PAT_ENC.VST_SPECIAL_NEEDS_C_NAME: This field captures any special needs for a visit.
PAT_ENC.BEN_ENG_SP_AMT: Stores the adjudicated self-pay amount (the amount required to be paid by the patient) when determining the copay amount for the visit.
PAT_ENC.BEN_ADJ_COPAY_AMT: Stores the adjudicated copy amount for the visit according to the patient's coverage benefits.
PAT_ENC.BEN_ADJ_METHOD_C_NAME: Flag to indicate if and how the adjudicated copay was overridden
PAT_ENC.ENC_CREATE_USER_ID: The ID number of the user who create the patient or encounter record.
PAT_ENC.ENC_CREATE_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC.ENC_INSTANT: The instant an encounter was created
PAT_ENC.EFFECTIVE_DATE_DTTM: The start date and time of an encounter. The start date is pulled from the date stored in the EFFECTIVE_DATE_DT column. The time references the first populated time in the following fields: hospital admission time (EPT 18851), hospital temporary admission time (EPT 18847), ADT arrival time (EPT 10815), and expected admission time (EPT 10300).  The SlicerDicer reporting application uses this column to determine the EffectiveStartDate of encounters.
PAT_ENC.CALCULATED_ENC_STAT_C_NAME: A status flag used to  determine whether to include data from the encounter in the SlicerDicer reporting application. Statuses includes 1-Possible (e.g., the encounter is a scheduled outpatient appointment or the admission is pending) or 2-Complete (e.g., the appointment is complete, the admission is discharged).

PAT_ENC_2._TABLE_: This table supplements the PAT_ENC table. It contains additional information related to patient encounters or appointments.
PAT_ENC_2.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique system identifier of the patient encounter. Contact serial number is unique across all patients and all contacts.
PAT_ENC_2.CONTACT_DATE: The date on which this patient encounter took place.
PAT_ENC_2.COPAY_COINS_FLAG: Set to 1 if copay is coinsurance.
PAT_ENC_2.CAN_LET_C_NAME: This column links to the type of canceled appointment letter sent for this patient encounter. Some examples are "No Letter", "No Show","Cancelation Letter", etc. This category column is linked to ZC_LET.LET_C.
PAT_ENC_2.SUP_PROV_ID: This column contains the provider ID of the supervising provider for this patient encounter.
PAT_ENC_2.SUP_PROV_C_NAME: This column links to information about the Type of Supervising provider.
PAT_ENC_2.SUP_PROV_REV_TM: This column contains the date and time when the supervising provider submitted his or her review
PAT_ENC_2.MEDS_REQUEST_PHR_ID: The pharmacy identifier from which the medications were requested.
PAT_ENC_2.MEDS_REQUEST_OP_C_NAME: This column contains information about the fill option for the medication request.
PAT_ENC_2.PHYS_BP: This contains the patient's blood pressure that was entered during the patient encounter.
PAT_ENC_2.VITALS_TAKEN_TM: Holds the time the vitals were taken
PAT_ENC_2.PHYS_TEMP_SRC_C_NAME: The source of the patient's temperature measurement.
PAT_ENC_2.PAT_PAIN_SCORE_C_NAME: This column indicates how much pain the patient was in via pain score.
PAT_ENC_2.PAT_PAIN_LOC_C_NAME: This column contains information about which body part is experiencing discomfort.
PAT_ENC_2.PAT_PAIN_EDU_YN: This column contains information as to whether pain education questions were asked.
PAT_ENC_2.PAT_PAIN_CMT: This column contains comments that were entered pertaining to the patient's pain
PAT_ENC_2.PAT_PAIN_SCALE_CAT: This item stores the pain scale category under which the pain score is collected.
PAT_ENC_2.SMOKING_STATUS_C_NAME: This simply stores information about whether the patient smokes, is quitting, etc.
PAT_ENC_2.PHYS_SPO2: Contains the blood oxygen saturation value for this encounter.
PAT_ENC_2.SYS_GEN_LOS_ID: This column contains the system generated Level of Service information to link to the procedures tables.
PAT_ENC_2.DOC_HX_SOURCE_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for the history documentation.  This category column is linked to ZC_HISTORY_SOURCE.HISTORY_SOURCE_C.
PAT_ENC_2.APPT_LET_C_NAME: This column links to the type of appointment letter that was sent to this patient for this patient encounter. Some examples are "No Letter", "Appt Letter", etc.  This category column is linked to ZC_LET.LET_C.
PAT_ENC_2.PARENT_ENC_CSN_ID: This item is a link to an encounter's parent encounter through the parent's contact serial number.  The contact serial number is the unique identifier for the encounter.
PAT_ENC_2.SYNC_IP_DATA_C_NAME: This is a contact-specific flag to tell Chart Sync whether inpatient clinical data for this visit (such as medication administration or documentation flowsheet data) should be synchronized between deployments. A value of 1 (or Yes) means that inpatient clinical data has been, and will continue to be, synchronized for this visit. Note that this item can only be set for a contact whose type is (or was at some point) an inpatient admission.
PAT_ENC_2.APPTMT_LET_INST: If an appointment letter has been printed for this patient encounter, this column will list the date and time it was printed. If multiple letters were printed, we'll list the date and time of the most recent one.
PAT_ENC_2.RESULT_LET_INST: If a result letter has been printed for this patient encounter, this column will list the date and time it was printed. If multiple letters were printed, we'll list the date and time of the most recent one.
PAT_ENC_2.RESCHED_LET_INST: If a reschedule letter has been printed for this patient encounter, this column will list the date and time it was printed. If multiple letters were printed, we'll list the date and time of the most recent one.
PAT_ENC_2.FOLLOW_LET_INST: If a follow-up letter has been printed for this patient encounter, this column will list the date and time it was printed. If multiple letters were printed, we'll list the date and time of the most recent one.
PAT_ENC_2.PHYS_PEAK_FLOW: This column contains a measurement of the flow of air from the lungs: Peak Flow. If this column contains data, the measurement was taken during the associated encounter.
PAT_ENC_2.ENC_SPEC_C_NAME: The encounter specialty item holds which of the encounter provider's specialties should be used for billing and reporting purposes for this encounter.
PAT_ENC_2.LD_STATUS_YN: Flag to denote if the encounter is for a mother who will deliver
PAT_ENC_2.ADT_PAT_CLASS_C_NAME: The category value corresponding to the Admission/Discharge/Transfer (ADT) patient classification for this patient contact.
PAT_ENC_2.OTHER_BLOCK_TYPE_C_NAME: Indicates the specific type of the episode summary, whose ID is stored in I EPT 1970.
PAT_ENC_2.BILL_NUM: Billing number, often used as an identifier in downstream systems.
PAT_ENC_2.IP_DOC_CONTACT_CSN: For Hospital Outpatient Visit (HOV) encounters, this column stores the unique contact serial number for the patient contact which is used for clinical documentation.  This can be set for appointment contacts if they are not converted to HOVs.
PAT_ENC_2.TEMP_PT_HIS_C: This item shows the temporary patient history.
PAT_ENC_2.PRIMARY_PROCONT_ID: The unique ID of the provider that is the primary contact for this patient encounter.
PAT_ENC_2.PRIMARY_TEAM_ID: The unique ID of the primary Provider Care Team for this patient encounter.
PAT_ENC_2.MCIR_VACCINE_CODE_C_NAME: The patient's eligibility code for Michigan's vaccination registry. This item only applies for the state of Michigan.
PAT_ENC_2.VISIT_POS_ID: The unique ID of the facility that was the place of service for this encounter.
PAT_ENC_2.NO_INTERP_RSN_C_NAME: This column holds the reason an interpreter is not needed for the visit (in the case of a patient who would normally require one). It is meant to be populated when the corresponding EPT 495-INTERPRETER NEEDED? value is "no".
PAT_ENC_2.CVG_ADD_DT: The add date returned in the response message by the payor for the encounter. The add date is defined as the date that the payor added the patient as being covered.
PAT_ENC_2.FARM_WORKER_C_NAME: The category number of the patient's farm worker status for the encounter or appointment.
PAT_ENC_2.KIOSK_HH_QUEST_ID: The unique ID of the health history template that is assigned to the patient encounter.
PAT_ENC_2.KIOSK_HH_QUEST_ID_RECORD_NAME: The name of the Visit Navigator (VN) History Template Definition (LQH) record.
PAT_ENC_2.HSP_ACCT_ADV_DTTM: If the Hospital Account Advisor is turned on, this item records the date and time that the advisor's recommendation was accepted or rejected.
PAT_ENC_2.VISIT_VERIFIED_YN: Indicates whether the visit is verified.
PAT_ENC_2.VERIF_VISIT_DT: The current date the visit contact was verified.
PAT_ENC_2.VERIF_DATE_INIT_DT: The initial date the visit contact was verified.
PAT_ENC_2.VERIF_USER_ID: This collects the user ID of the user who verified the visit.
PAT_ENC_2.ENC_LACT_STAT_C_NAME: The lactation status category ID for the patient.
PAT_ENC_2.PAT_LACT_CMNT: The comments entered when the patient's lactation status has been edited.
PAT_ENC_2.COSIGNER_USER_ID: The unique ID of the user who cosigned the patient's chart.
PAT_ENC_2.COSIGNER_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC_2.COSIGN_REV_INS_DTTM: The date and time the chart was cosigned.
PAT_ENC_2.IS_LOS_UPDATE_C_NAME: Stores the status of any Level of Service updates.
PAT_ENC_2.FORM_ID_COUNTER: Stores the counter of form IDs.
PAT_ENC_2.CONSNT_REV_USER_ID: The unique ID of the user who reviewed patient consent.
PAT_ENC_2.CONSNT_REV_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
PAT_ENC_2.VISIT_PAYOR_ID: The unique ID of the payor that is associated with this encounter.
PAT_ENC_2.VISIT_PLAN_ID: The unique ID of the plan that is associated with this encounter.
PAT_ENC_2.SOCIO_SRC_C_NAME: Stores the source of entry for the sociological history.
PAT_ENC_2.TEL_ENC_MSG_RGRDING: Free-text field containing user entered information regarding a telephone encounter message.
PAT_ENC_2.MSG_PRIORITY_C_NAME: Indicates the priority of the routed message.
PAT_ENC_2.RESEARCH_ENC_FLG_C_NAME: Category ID of the research encounter flag used to mark the patient encounter as having all charges billed to a research study, the patient, or a mixture.  This is used for charge routing.
PAT_ENC_2.FAM_SPOUSE_NAME: The name of the patient's spouse
PAT_ENC_2.MSG_CALLER_NAME: The name of the caller who left this message
PAT_ENC_2.CONSENT_EXP_DATE: This is the expiration date of any consent forms that are attached to the patient.
PAT_ENC_2.CV_ACC4_PAT_RESP_YN: Indicates whether a patient wants identifying information to be excluded from submission to the American College of Cardiology-National Cardiovascular Data Registry's (ACC-NCDR) Catheterization and/or Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (CathPCI) registry.
PAT_ENC_2.FAMILY_MEM_PREFIX_C_NAME: This column stores the relationship between the patient and the patient's guarantor.
PAT_ENC_2.AVS_REFUSED_DTTM: The date and time when an end user documented that the patient declined the After Visit Summary.
PAT_ENC_2.AVS_LAST_PRINT_DTTM: Records the instant the After Visit Summary was last printed
PAT_ENC_2.MED_LIST_UPDATE_DTTM: If a patient's prescriptions or Facility-Administered Medications (FAMs) are updated (signed, modified, or discontinued; or other med reconciliation actions are changed) after the After Visit Summary (AVS) has been printed, this item is updated to hold a timestamp indicating the last time that such updates were made. It is left blank if no AVS has been printed yet.

PAT_ENC_DX._TABLE_: The patient encounter diagnosis table contains one record for each diagnosis associated with each encounter level of service. This table will contain all diagnoses specified on the Order Summary screen.
PAT_ENC_DX.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: This is a numeric representation of the date of this encounter in your system. The integer portion of the number specifies the date of the encounter. The digits after the decimal point indicate multiple visits on one day.
PAT_ENC_DX.LINE: The line number of the diagnosis within the encounter. This is the second column in the primary key and uniquely identifies this diagnosis on the encounter.
PAT_ENC_DX.CONTACT_DATE: The contact date of the encounter associated with this diagnosis. Note: There may be multiple encounters on the same calendar date.
PAT_ENC_DX.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: A unique serial number for this encounter. This number is unique across all patients and encounters in the system.
PAT_ENC_DX.DX_ID: The unique ID of the diagnosis record associated with the patient encounter. Note: This is NOT the ICD9 diagnosis code. It is an internal identifier that is typically not visible to a user.
PAT_ENC_DX.ANNOTATION: The annotation (description) text entered for this diagnosis by the clinical system user. This field is NULL if no annotation was entered during the encounter.  Order entry in clinical system limits this field to 160 characters.
PAT_ENC_DX.DX_QUALIFIER_C_NAME: The category value for the diagnosis qualifier. This field is null if no qualifier was entered.
PAT_ENC_DX.PRIMARY_DX_YN: This is a one character field that indicates whether this diagnosis was the primary diagnosis for the encounter. If the diagnosis was the primary this field will have a value of 'Y' otherwise it will have a value of 'N'.
PAT_ENC_DX.COMMENTS: Any text comment associated with the encounter diagnosis. This field is NULL if no comment was provided.
PAT_ENC_DX.DX_CHRONIC_YN: Stores the chronic flag for a diagnosis.
PAT_ENC_DX.DX_UNIQUE: Unique identifier given when a diagnosis is added to the encounter diagnosis list.
PAT_ENC_DX.DX_ED_YN: Definitively identifies an encounter diagnosis (I EDG 18400) as being an ED clinical impression. This is important to differentiate ED diagnoses from diagnoses filed to the same item as in the IP setting.
PAT_ENC_DX.DX_LINK_PROB_ID: Stores the problem ID of the linked problem.

PAT_ENC_RSN_VISIT._TABLE_: The PAT_ENC_RSN_VISIT contains the data entered as the Reason for Visit for a clinical system encounter. Each row in this table is one reason for visit associated with a patient encounter. One patient encounter may have multiple reasons for visit; therefore, the item LINE is used to identify each reason for visit within an encounter.
PAT_ENC_RSN_VISIT.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: A unique serial number for this encounter. This number is unique across all patients and encounters in the system.
PAT_ENC_RSN_VISIT.LINE: The line number of the reason for visit within the encounter.
PAT_ENC_RSN_VISIT.ENC_REASON_ID: The ID of the record associated with the Reason for Visit entered in an encounter.
PAT_ENC_RSN_VISIT.COMMENTS: The comments associated with the reason for visit entered in a clinical system exam encounter.
PAT_ENC_RSN_VISIT.RFV_ONSET_DT: The onset date for reason for call/visit stored on this line.  Typically this value will only be collected during call workflows such as a telephone encounter.
PAT_ENC_RSN_VISIT.BODY_LOC_ID: The body location associated with the reason for visit for this patient encounter. This column is frequently used to link to the VESSEL_DOC table.

title: Messages: MYC_MESG → MSG_TXT → Message → HealthRecord.messages

MYC_MESG._TABLE_: This table contains information on messages sent to and from web-based chart system patients.
MYC_MESG.MESSAGE_ID: The unique ID used to identify a web-based chart system message record. A new record is created each time a patient sends a message from a web-based chart system to a system user and each time a system user sends a message to a web-based chart system patient.
MYC_MESG.CREATED_TIME: The date and time the web-based chart system message record was created in local time.
MYC_MESG.PARENT_MESSAGE_ID: The unique ID of the original message in a chain of web-based chart system messages between patients and system users.
MYC_MESG.INBASKET_MSG_ID: The unique ID of the system message associated with the web-based chart system message. An example is when a patient sends a message to a system user.
MYC_MESG.PAT_ID: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
MYC_MESG.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL: A unique, internal contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of the contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
MYC_MESG.FROM_USER_ID: The unique ID of the system user who sent a web-based chart system message to a patient.
MYC_MESG.FROM_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
MYC_MESG.TO_USER_ID: The unique ID of the system user who was sent a web-based chart system message from a patient.
MYC_MESG.TO_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
MYC_MESG.TOFROM_PAT_C_NAME: The message direction category number for the web-based chart system message. 1 corresponds to "To patient". 2 corresponds to "From patient".
MYC_MESG.ORIGINAL_TO: If a message sent from a web-based chart system patient is re-routed from its intended destination, then the ID of the original recipient is stored in the field. Most commonly this occurs when a system user does not accept messages directly from web-based chart system patients. In this case, the message will be re-routed to a pool, but the employee ID of the system user will be stored here. The ID of the final destination is stored in MODIFIED_TO.
MYC_MESG.RQSTD_PHARMACY_ID: The unique ID of the pharmacy selected by the patient from the drop down list when sending a Medication Renewal Request message.
MYC_MESG.UPDATE_DATE: The date and time that this web-based chart system message record was pulled into enterprise reporting.
MYC_MESG.REQUEST_SUBJECT: This field is only used for medical advice request messages and indicates the subject selected by the patient from the drop down list.
MYC_MESG.PROV_ID: The provider that was used in routing the patient access message. The provider may vary depending on message type.
MYC_MESG.DEPARTMENT_ID: The department used in routing the patient access message. The department may vary depending on message type.
MYC_MESG.RESP_INFO: Some response types will include additional information, such as a phone number.  If such data exists for the chosen response method, it will be stored in this field.
MYC_MESG.SUBJECT: The subject line of the web-based chart system message.
MYC_MESG.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
MYC_MESG.EOW_READ_STATUS_C_NAME: The read status category number for the web-based chart system message.
MYC_MESG.BILL_ACCT_ID: The unique ID of the guarantor account associated with this web-based chart system message.
MYC_MESG.BILL_ACCT_TYPE_C_NAME: The billing account type category number for the web-based chart system message. Only billing-specific customer service messages have a value specified for this column.
MYC_MESG.BILL_ACCT_HAR_ID: The unique ID of the hospital account associated with this web-based chart system message.
MYC_MESG.RELATED_MESSAGE_ID: The unique ID of the parent message of the original message chain. This applies only when the system is configured to allow patients to reply to messages associated with closed encounters by creating a new message chain. This item is populated for the message that starts a new chain.
MYC_MESG.WPR_OWNER_WPR_ID: The unique ID of the web-based chart system patient who owns this message.
MYC_MESG.CR_TX_CARD_ID: The unique ID of the credit card used for this transaction.
MYC_MESG.CR_TX_MYPT_ID: The unique ID of the web-based chart system patient associated with this transaction.
MYC_MESG.CR_TX_AMOUNT_AUTH: The amount authorized for this transaction.
MYC_MESG.PAT_HX_QUESR_ID: The unique ID of the history questionnaire associated with this message.
MYC_MESG.PAT_HX_QUESR_ID_RECORD_NAME: The name of the Visit Navigator (VN) History Template Definition (LQH) record.
MYC_MESG.HX_QUESR_CONTEXT_C_NAME: The history questionnaire context category number for the web-based chart system message.
MYC_MESG.HX_QUESR_PROV_ID: The unique ID of the provider associated with the questionnaire.
MYC_MESG.HX_QUESR_ENCPROV_ID: The unique ID of the provider associated with the appointment that the questionnaire is linked to.
MYC_MESG.HX_QUESR_APPT_DAT: The appointment contact date (DAT) if the questionnaire is linked to an appointment.
MYC_MESG.HX_QUESR_FILED_YN: Indicates whether the history questionnaire has been filed for this web-based chart system message. Y indicates that the history questionnaire has been filed. N or a null value indicates that the history questionnaire has not been filed.
MYC_MESG.DELIVERY_DTTM: The instant that this message is scheduled for delivery to the patient. This item may not be populated. In the event that this item is not populated, then the instant the message is created is used to determine when the patient can view the message.
MYC_MESG.RECORD_STATUS_C_NAME: The category title of the status of the message. If not populated, then the message is active; Soft deleted is set when a message is revoked.
MYC_MESG.CR_TX_TYPE_C_NAME: Stores the type of transaction (E-Visit or Copay).
MYC_MESG.HX_QUESR_REVIEW_YN: Indicates whether the history questionnaire has been viewed by a provider in edit mode for this web-based chart system message. Y indicates that the history questionnaire has been viewed, N or a null value indicates that the history questionnaire has not been viewed.
MYC_MESG.HX_QUESR_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for the appt contact if questionnaire is linked to an appt. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
MYC_MESG.OUTREACH_RUN_ID: This is the campaign outreach configuration template associated with this message.
MYC_MESG.RENEWAL_REQ_SRC_C_NAME: This item stores the request source of a medication renewal request. The  default is 2-Web.
MYC_MESG.REQ_PHARM_FREE_TEXT: If the selected pharmacy was entered by the user as free-text, then it is stored here.
MYC_MESG.HX_QUESR_EDIT_MYPT_ID: Stores the Patient Access Account (WPR) record for the user who last made changes to an in progress history questionnaire
MYC_MESG.HX_QUESR_EDIT_INST_DTTM: Stores the time at which changes were last made to an in progress history questionnaire
MYC_MESG.REFERRAL_ID: The unique ID of the referral this message is associated with.
MYC_MESG.COMM_ID: The customer service record ID corresponding to the message
MYC_MESG.AUTH_REQUEST_ID: The authorization request this message is associated with.
MYC_MESG.INFO_REQ_CSN_ID: The Information Request this message is associated with.
MYC_MESG.NON_HX_QUESR_WITH_HX_DATA_YN: 1 - If WMG stores history data even though the WMG type is not 22 - HISTORY Questionnaire.

MSG_TXT._TABLE_: This table contains the text of MyChart messages.
MSG_TXT.MESSAGE_ID: The unique identifier for the message record.
MSG_TXT.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
MSG_TXT.MSG_TXT: Stores the body text in the message.

MYC_MESG_RTF_TEXT._TABLE_: Patient message content, in RTF format. Replaces item 100 (plain text message body). Further, this content contains only the current message, whereas the plain text item might have appended previous messages in addition to the current message.
MYC_MESG_RTF_TEXT.MESSAGE_ID: The unique identifier for the message record.
MYC_MESG_RTF_TEXT.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
MYC_MESG_RTF_TEXT.RTF_TXT: The text of a message, in RTF format.

title: Billing: ARPB_TRANSACTIONS → BillingTransaction → HealthRecord.billing

ARPB_TRANSACTIONS._TABLE_: This table contains information about professional billing transactions.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.TX_ID: A transaction's unique internal identification number. A patient's record can include charges, payments, or adjustments and the patient's account balance will reflect these transactions.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.POST_DATE: The date when a transaction is entered into the billing system.  This differs from the service date, which is the date when the service was performed.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.SERVICE_DATE: The date a medical service is performed.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.TX_TYPE_C_NAME: The type of this transaction: Charge, payment or adjustment.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.ACCOUNT_ID: The internal ID of the record that maintains the patient's transactions. A patient may use more than one account and an account may contain more than one patient.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.DEBIT_CREDIT_FLAG_NAME: This column contains a 1 if the transaction is a debit and a -1 if the transaction is a credit. A charge is always a debit, a payment is always a credit, and an adjustment can be either a debit or a credit.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.SERV_PROVIDER_ID: The internal identifier of the provider who performed the medical services on the patient.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.BILLING_PROV_ID: The billing provider associated with the transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.DEPARTMENT_ID: The department ID of the department associated with the transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.POS_ID: The place of service ID of the place of service associated with the transaction
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.LOC_ID: The location ID of the location associated with the transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.SERVICE_AREA_ID: The service area ID of the service area associated with the transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.MODIFIER_ONE: The first procedure modifier associated with this transaction. This is the external modifier, as it would be printed on the claim.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.MODIFIER_TWO: The second procedure modifier associated with this transaction. This is the external modifier, as it would be printed on the claim.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.MODIFIER_THREE: The third procedure modifier associated with this transaction. This is the external modifier, as it would be printed on the claim.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.MODIFIER_FOUR: The fourth procedure modifier associated with this transaction. This is the external modifier, as it would be printed on the claim.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.PRIMARY_DX_ID: The primary diagnosis ID associated with the transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.DX_TWO_ID: The second diagnosis ID associated with the transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.DX_THREE_ID: The third diagnosis ID associated with the transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.DX_FOUR_ID: The fourth diagnosis ID associated with the transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.DX_FIVE_ID: The fifth diagnosis ID associated with the transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.DX_SIX_ID: The sixth diagnosis ID associated with the transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.PROCEDURE_QUANTITY: The quantity as entered in Charge Entry for the procedure of this transaction (TX_ID). If the row has a DETAIL_TYPE value of 10-13, this column displays a negative value. If the row has a DETAIL_TYPE value of 20-33, 43-45, 50, or 51, this column displays a zero.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.AMOUNT: The original amount of this transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.OUTSTANDING_AMT: The outstanding amount of the transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.INSURANCE_AMT: The insurance portion of the transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.PATIENT_AMT: The patient or self-pay portion of the transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.VOID_DATE: If this transaction is voided, this column will have the date in which this transaction is voided.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.LAST_ACTION_DATE: This column contains the most recent date when an action is performed on this transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.PROV_SPECIALTY_C_NAME: This column contains the provider specialty of the provider associated with the transaction. The procedure category of the charge on the transaction may affect what specialty is recorded here and in the "Encounter Specialty" displayed in Hyperspace.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.PROC_ID: The Procedure ID of the procedure associated with the transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.TOTAL_MATCH_AMT: This column contains the total amount matched to the transaction, including adjustments.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.TOTAL_MTCH_INS_AMT: This column contains the total insurance amount matched to the transaction, including adjustments.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.TOTAL_MTCH_ADJ: This column contains the total adjustment amount matched to the transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.TOTAL_MTCH_INS_ADJ: This column contains the total insurance adjustment amount matched to the transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.REPOST_ETR_ID: This is the repost source transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.REPOST_TYPE_C_NAME: The repost type category ID for the transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.DISCOUNT_TYPE_C_NAME: The discount type category ID for the transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The Contact Serial Number for the patient encounter with which this transaction is associated. This number is unique across all patients and encounters in your system.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.ENC_FORM_NUM: The encounter form number corresponding to the charge transaction. If you are not using encounter forms, a negative number is stored in this item.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.BEN_SELF_PAY_AMT: Stores the adjudicated self-pay amount calculated by the benefits engine
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.BEN_ADJ_COPAY_AMT: Stores the copay part of the adjudicated self-pay amount calculated by the benefits engine
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.BEN_ADJ_COINS_AMT: Stores the coinsurance part of the adjudicated self-pay amount calculated by the benefits engine
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.VISIT_NUMBER: This item stores the visit number for this transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.REFERRAL_ID: This item stores the Referral (RFL) ID for this transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.ORIGINAL_EPM_ID: This item stores the original payor (EPM) ID for this transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.ORIGINAL_FC_C_NAME: This item stores the original financial class for this transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.ORIGINAL_CVG_ID: This item stores the original coverage (CVG) ID for this transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.PAYOR_ID: This item stores the current payor (EPM) ID for this transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.COVERAGE_ID: This item stores the current coverage (CVG) ID for this transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.ASGN_YN: This item stores the assignment flag for a coverage.  This item is set to Yes if the charge is currently assigned to the payor in the PAYOR_ID column.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.FACILITY_ID: This item stores the facility (EAF) ID for this transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.PAYMENT_SOURCE_C_NAME: This item stores the payment source for credit transactions. This is a list of possible sources including Cash, Check, Credit Card, etc.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.USER_ID: This item stores the user who posted the transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.NOT_BILL_INS_YN: Indicates whether the transaction is marked for do not bill insurance.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.CHG_ROUTER_SRC_ID: This item stores the universal charge line (UCL) ID for this transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.RECEIVE_DATE: This item stores the charge entry batch receive date.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.CE_CODED_DATE: The date this�charge session was coded, from charge entry.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.PANEL_ID: The ID of the panel procedure that generated this transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.BILL_AREA_ID: Networked to BIL: the Bill Area for this transaction.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.BILL_AREA_ID_BILL_AREA_NAME: The record name of this bill area, financial subdivision, or financial division.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.CREDIT_SRC_MODULE_C_NAME: The module that creates a payment or credit adjustment
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.UPDATE_DATE: The date that this row was last updated.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.CLAIM_DATE: The most recent date that this transaction has been on an accepted claim run.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.IPP_INV_NUMBER: This item stores the original invoice number that user posts to in GUI payment posting or remittance.
ARPB_TRANSACTIONS.IPP_INV_ID: This item stores the original invoice ID that user posts to in�graphical user interface�(GUI) payment posting or remittance.

ARPB_VISITS._TABLE_: This table contains Professional Billing visit information stored in the Hospital Accounts Receivable (HAR) master file. It doesn�t include HAR records created for Hospital Billing and Single Billing Office.
ARPB_VISITS.PB_VISIT_ID: The unique identifier for the Professional Billing visit.
ARPB_VISITS.PB_BILLING_STATUS_C_NAME: This column stores the Professional Billing status category ID for the visit.
ARPB_VISITS.PB_FO_OVRRD_ST_C_NAME: This column indicates whether the Professional Billing filing order has been overridden by a user.
ARPB_VISITS.PB_FO_MSPQ_STATE_C_NAME: This column indicates whether the filing order for the Professional Billing visit has been verified by Medicare Secondary Payer Questionnaire logic.
ARPB_VISITS.PB_VISIT_NUM: This column stores the PB visit number.
ARPB_VISITS.PRIM_ENC_CSN_ID: The contact serial number associated with the primary patient contact on the Professional Billing visit.
ARPB_VISITS.GUARANTOR_ID: Stores the guarantor ID associated with the Professional Billing visit.
ARPB_VISITS.COVERAGE_ID: The primary coverage on the Professional Billing visit.
ARPB_VISITS.SELF_PAY_YN: Indicates whether the Professional Billing visit is self-pay.
ARPB_VISITS.DO_NOT_BILL_INS_YN: Indicates�whether the Professional Billing visit has the Do Not Bill Insurance flag set.
ARPB_VISITS.ACCT_FIN_CLASS_C_NAME: The financial class category ID�for the Professional Billing visit.
ARPB_VISITS.SERV_AREA_ID: The service area of the Professional Billing visit.
ARPB_VISITS.REVENUE_LOCATION_ID: The revenue location of the Professional Billing visit.
ARPB_VISITS.DEPARTMENT_ID: The department of the Professional Billing visit.
ARPB_VISITS.PB_TOTAL_BALANCE: Contains the combined total balance of transactions on the PB visit.
ARPB_VISITS.PB_TOTAL_CHARGES: The total charges on the PB visit.
ARPB_VISITS.PB_TOTAL_PAYMENTS: The total payments on the PB visit.
ARPB_VISITS.PB_TOTAL_ADJ: Contains total adjustments on the PB visit.
ARPB_VISITS.PB_INS_BALANCE: Contains insurance balance on the PB visit.
ARPB_VISITS.PB_UND_BALANCE: Contains undistributed balances on the PB visit.
ARPB_VISITS.PB_SELFPAY_BALANCE: Contains the self-pay balance on the Professional Billing visit.
ARPB_VISITS.PB_BAD_DEBT_BALANCE: Contains the bad debt balance on the Professional Billing visit.
ARPB_VISITS.REC_CREATE_USER_ID: The user who created the Professional Billing visit record.
ARPB_VISITS.REC_CREATE_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ARPB_VISITS.FIRST_PB_CHG_TX_ID: Contains the first valid Professional Billing charge on the Professional Billing visit.
ARPB_VISITS.BAL_FULL_SELF_PAY_YN: This item shows whether the balances for this hospital account are in full self-pay.

ARPB_TX_ACTIONS._TABLE_: This table contains information about actions performed on professional billing transactions.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.TX_ID: The unique key or identification number for a given transaction.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.LINE: This column contains the line count for the information in this table. Each action associated with this transaction is stored on a separate line, one line for each entry.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.ACTION_TYPE_C_NAME: The action type category ID taken on the transaction.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.ACTION_DATE: The date in which this action is performed.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.ACTION_AMOUNT: The amount associated with this action.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.PAYOR_ID: The Payor associated with this action.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.DENIAL_CODE: The denial code associated with this action.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.DENIAL_CODE_REMIT_CODE_NAME: The name of each remittance code.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.POST_DATE: The date this transaction was posted in calendar format.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.STMT_DATE: The statement date of this transaction.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.OUT_AMOUNT_BEFORE: Outstanding amount of associated transaction before the action is performed.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.OUT_AMOUNT_AFTER: Outstanding amount of the associated transaction after the action is performed.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.INS_AMOUNT_BEFORE: Insurance amount of the associated transaction before the action is performed.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.INS_AMOUNT_AFTER: Insurance amount of the associated transaction after the action is performed.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.BEFORE_PAYOR_ID: The Payor of the associated transaction before the action is performed.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.AFTER_PAYOR_ID: The Payor of the associated transaction after the action is performed.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.BEFORE_CVG_ID: The coverage of the associated transaction before the action is performed.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.AFTER_CVG_ID: The coverage of the associated transaction after the action is performed.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.ACTION_USER_ID: The unique ID of the user who performed this action.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.ACTION_USER_ID_NAME: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.ADJ_CODE_ID: If an adjustment is associated with this action, this column contains the adjustment code of that adjustment.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.RMC_ID: The first reason code ID associated with this action.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.RMC_ID_REMIT_CODE_NAME: The name of each remittance code.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.RMC_TWO_ID: The second reason code�ID associated with this action.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.RMC_TWO_ID_REMIT_CODE_NAME: The name of each remittance code.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.RMC_THREE_ID: The third reason code ID associated with this action.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.RMC_THREE_ID_REMIT_CODE_NAME: The name of each remittance code.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.RMC_FOUR_ID: The fourth reason code ID associated with this action.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.RMC_FOUR_ID_REMIT_CODE_NAME: The name of each remittance code.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.PMT_PAYOR_ID: The Payor of the payment if this action is associated with a payment.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.POS_ID: Place of Service ID of the transaction.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.PROC_ID: The procedure ID for the transaction record.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.SERVICE_AREA_ID: Service Area ID for this transaction
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.ACCOUNT_ID: The internal ID of the record that maintains the patient's transactions. A patient may use more than one account and an account may contain more than one patient.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.PRIMARY_DX_ID: Primary Diagnosis code for this charge.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.MODIFIER_ONE: The first procedure modifier of the associated transaction. This is the external modifier, as it would be printed on the claim.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.MODIFIER_TWO: The second procedure modifier of the associated transaction. This is the external modifier, as it would be printed on the claim.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.MODIFIER_THREE: The third modifier of the associated transaction. This is the external modifier, as it would be printed on the claim.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.MODIFIER_FOUR: The fourth modifier of the associated transaction. This is the external modifier, as it would be printed on the claim.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.ASSIGNMENT_BEF_YN: This item is a Yes/No flag to determine if the transaction was assigned to insurance before the action on this line for this transaction.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.ASSIGNMENT_AFTER_YN: This item is a Yes/No flag to determine if the transaction was assigned to insurance after the action on this line for this transaction.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.ACTION_REMIT_CODES: This field stores a comma delimited list of external remittance codes for this transaction.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.ACTION_COMMENT: This is the system generated comment for this transaction.
ARPB_TX_ACTIONS.ACTION_DATETIME: The UTC date and time the action was performed.

CLARITY_EPM.PAYOR_ID: The unique ID assigned to the payor.

title: Family History: FAMILY_HX_STATUS + FAMILY_HX → HealthRecord.familyHistory

FAMILY_HX_STATUS._TABLE_: Family status relationship table.  Contains the relationship to the patient and the name of the family member, as well as the source of this information.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.LINE: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.CONTACT_DATE: The date of this contact in calendar format.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_REL_C_NAME: The family status relationship category number for the relationship between the patient and their family member.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_STATUS_C_NAME: The family status category number for the family member, such as 1 for "alive" and 2 for "deceased".
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_DEATH_AGE: Age of family member at their death.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_COMMENT: This item contains the free text comments associated with a patient's family member status in medical history.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_SRC_C_NAME: The family status source category number for the source of corresponding family status information.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.HX_LNK_ENC_CSN: The Contact Serial Number of the encounter in which the history was created/edited. If the history was created/edited outside of the context of an encounter, then this column will be blank.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_DOB_DT: This is used to calculate the age of a relative. This is either the date of birth (approximate or exact) or part of a range. If it is a range, then this column will be the beginning date and FAM_STAT_DOB_END_DT will store the end date. This range of dates is used to define an age range.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_ID: The Unique ID for the family member.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_DOB_END_DT: If an age range is entered for a family member, then the range is stored as two dates. This column holds the end date and FAM_STAT_DOB_DT holds the beginning date.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_TWIN: This item tracks twin relationships among members of the patient's family.  Two family members who are twins (or three who are triplets, etc.) will have the same value on their lines of this item.  A value of 0 indicates that the family member is a twin of the patient.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_IDENT_TWIN: This item tracks identical twin relationships among members of the patient's family.  Two family members who are identical twins (or three who are identical triplets, etc.) will have the same value on their lines of this item.  A value of 0 indicates that the family member is an identical twin of the patient.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_COD_C_NAME: The cause of death of a family member of the patient.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_SEX_C_NAME: This item stores the sex of a family member of the patient.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_GENDER_IDENTITY_C_NAME: Gender identity for a family member.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_REL_ID: This item stores the unique ID of the patient relationship record. The patient relationship record contains information about how the person is related to the patient.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_ADOPT_C_NAME: Adoption status of a particular family member.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_ADPT_PAR_1: The ID of a relative's adoptive parent. We allow two adoptive parents. The other adoptive parent ID is stored in I EPT 20359.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_ADPT_PAR_2: The ID of a relative's adoptive parent. We allow two adoptive parents. The other adoptive parent ID is stored in I EPT 20358.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_PREG_EPISODE_ID: This item stores a link to the patient's pregnancy information in Obstetric history.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_STAT_DELIV_EPISODE_ID: This item stores a link to the patient's delivery information for Obstetric History.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_HX_FERT_STAT_C_NAME: This field contains the category value representing a patient's relative's fertility status.
FAMILY_HX_STATUS.FAM_HX_FERT_NOTE: This field is a free text item holding notes pertaining to a particular relative's fertility status.

FAMILY_HX._TABLE_: The FAMILY_HX table contains data recorded in the family history contacts entered in the patient's chart during a clinical system encounter. Note: This table is designed to hold a patient's history over time; however, it is most typically implemented to only extract the latest patient history contact.
FAMILY_HX.LINE: The line number to identify the family history contact within the patient�s record.  NOTE: Each line of history is stored in enterprise reporting as its own record; a given patient may have multiple records (identified by line number) that reflect multiple lines of history.
FAMILY_HX.MEDICAL_HX_C_NAME: The category value associated with the Problem documented in the patient�s family history.
FAMILY_HX.MEDICAL_OTHER: The custom reason for visit or problem entered when the clinical system user chooses "Other" as a family history problem. NOTE: The comment is stored in the same item as MEDICAL_HX_C but is delimited from the response "Other" by the comment character, "[". The EPIC_GET_COMMENT function returns everything after the comment character.
FAMILY_HX.COMMENTS: Free-text comments entered with this problem. This column may be hidden in a public enterprise reporting view.
FAMILY_HX.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID: A unique serial number for this encounter. This number is unique across all patients and encounters in the system.
FAMILY_HX.FAM_HX_SRC_C_NAME: This item contains the source of information for a patient's family medical history.
FAMILY_HX.RELATION_C_NAME: This is the category value associated with the family member who has or had this problem. An example might be sister, brother, or mother.
FAMILY_HX.FAM_RELATION_NAME: This is the first and/or last name of the patient's family member. This column is free-text and is meant to be used together with the RELATION_C category to form a unique key for the family member. If no name is entered this column will display an abbreviation of the family relation type beginning with ##.
FAMILY_HX.AGE_OF_ONSET: This item contains the age of onset of the patient's family member that is documented with a history of a problem.
FAMILY_HX.FAM_MED_REL_ID: This item contains the unique ID of the patient's family member relationship for medical history.
FAMILY_HX.FAM_MEDICAL_DX_ID: The unique ID of the diagnosis associated with the family member condition.
FAMILY_HX.AGE_OF_ONSET_END: When the age of onset for a family member's history of a problem is documented as an age range, this item contains the age at the end of the range.
